net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base

Class AbstractSearchIndexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableObject
      • net.sf.mmm.search.indexer.base.AbstractSearchIndexer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable, SearchIndexer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LuceneSearchIndexer

    public abstract class AbstractSearchIndexer
extends AbstractLoggableObject
implements SearchIndexer
    This is the abstract base implementation of the SearchIndexer interface.
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • add

        protected abstract void add(MutableSearchEntry entry,
                            Long id)
        Parameters:
        entry - is the MutableSearchEntry to add.
        id - is the ID for the entry.
        See Also:
        SearchIndexer.add(MutableSearchEntry)

      • update

        public int update(MutableSearchEntry entry)
           throws SearchException
        This method updates the given entry in the search-index. This method will use the property SearchEntry.FIELD_CUSTOM_ID to identify a potentially existing entry to update. Otherwise it will use a combination of SearchEntry.FIELD_URI and SearchEntry.FIELD_SOURCE as identifier (what is NOT a very strong ID as the URI can change).
        Specified by:
        update in interface SearchIndexer
        Parameters:
        entry - is the entry to update.
        Returns:
        the number of entries that have been replaced. This should typically be 1 if one entry was replaced or 0 none was replaced and the given entry has only been added. A value greater than 1 indicates that multiple entries have been replaced that all have the same identifier what indicates a mistake of your index or the indexer.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(SearchHit hit)
               throws SearchException
        This method removes an existing entry identified by the given hit. In most cases this method will delegate to SearchIndexer.removeById(Long). However the implementation can decide what is the best way to do it.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface SearchIndexer
        Parameters:
        hit - is the SearchHit to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the entry existed and has been removed from the index, false if NO entry exists for the given hit.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • removeByCustumId

        public int removeByCustumId(String uid)
                     throws SearchException
        This method removes an existing entry identified by the given uri from the search-index.
        Specified by:
        removeByCustumId in interface SearchIndexer
        Parameters:
        uid - is the custom-ID of an entry previously added to the index.
        Returns:
        the number of entries that have been removed. This should typically be 1 if one entry exists with the given uid or 0 if no such entry exists. A value greater than 1 indicates that multiple entries have been removed that all have the given uid what indicates a mistake of your index(er). A value of -1 means the number is unknown because this is not supported by the implementation.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.
        See Also:
        SearchIndexer.update(MutableSearchEntry)

      • removeById

        public boolean removeById(Long id)
                   throws SearchException
        This method removes an existing entry identified by the given id from the search-index.
        ATTENTION:
        If you are using lucene as implementation according to some questionable design of lucene this method has to close the IndexWriter and create an IndexReader to perform the delete. If you invoke an other method after that the same has to be done reverse. This can cause really bad performance.
        Specified by:
        removeById in interface SearchIndexer
        Parameters:
        id - is the ID of the entry to remove (NOT null).
        Returns:
        true if the entry existed and has been removed from the index, false if NO entry exists for the given id.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.

      • removeByUri

        public int removeByUri(String uri,
                       String sourceId)
                throws SearchException
        This method removes an existing entry identified by the given uri from the search-index.
        Specified by:
        removeByUri in interface SearchIndexer
        Parameters:
        uri - is the URI of an entry previously added to the index.
        sourceId - is the ID of the SearchSource. This is required because the uri itself may NOT be unique (e.g. different sources might both contain the entry with URI "index.html").
        Returns:
        the number of entries that have been removed. This should typically be 1 if one entry exists with the given uri or 0 if no such entry exists. A value greater than 1 indicates that multiple entries have been removed that all have the given uri. A value of -1 means the number is unknown because this is not supported by the implementation.
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the operation failed.
        See Also:
        SearchIndexer.update(MutableSearchEntry)

      • remove

        protected int remove(SearchResultPage page)
        This method removes all hits of the given SearchResultPage.
        Parameters:
        page - is the SearchResultPage to delete.
        Returns:
        the value of SearchResultPage.getPageCount().

      • search

        protected SearchResultPage search(Long id,
                                  Object cid,
                                  String uri,
                                  String source)
        This method searches the entries with the specified properties. At least one of the properties has to be set (not null).
        Parameters:
        id - is the ID or null if any ID should match.
        cid - is the custom-ID or null if any custom-ID should match.
        uri - is the URI or null if any URI should match.
        source - is the source or null if any source should match.
        Returns:
        the SearchResultPage for the specified query.
